distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for nagios fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-8641 / CVE-2016-10089: fixed possible symlink attacks for files/directories created by root (bsc#1011630 / bsc#1018047)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Nagios 4.3.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges via a hard link attack on the Nagios init script file, related to CVE-2016-8641.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: A privilege escalation vulnerability was found in nagios 4.2.x that occurs in daemon-init.in when creating necessary files and insecurely changing the ownership afterwards. It's possible for the local attacker to create symbolic links before the files are to be created and possibly escalating the privileges with the ownership change.
notes.title: CVE description
